bug.author: r4nc0r
bug.description:
Describe the bug I'm running espnet2/commonvoice (german) and the training of the language Model fails with a RuntimeError. In the log file its says: <denchmark-code>The training was finished at 20 epochs free(): invalid pointer </denchmark-code>
Basic environments:
OS information: Ubuntu 18.04 python version: 3.8.3 GCC 7.3.0 espnet version: 0.9.5 Git hash 53d1700
Commit date Sat Nov 7 04:13:45 2020 +0000
pytorch version 1.7.0
Environments from torch.utils.collect_env: PyTorch version: 1.7.0 Is debug build: True CUDA used to build PyTorch: 11.0 ROCM used to build PyTorch: N/A OS: Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS (x86_64) GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.5.0-3ubuntu1~18.04) 7.5.0 Clang version: Could not collect CMake version: version 3.10.2 Python version: 3.8 (64-bit runtime) Is CUDA available: True CUDA runtime version: Could not collect GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce RTX 3090 Nvidia driver version: 455.23.05 cuDNN version: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.6.5 HIP runtime version: N/A MIOpen runtime version: N/A Versions of relevant libraries: [pip3] numpy==1.19.2 [pip3] pytorch-ranger==0.1.1 [pip3] pytorch-wpe==0.0.0 [pip3] torch==1.7.0 [pip3] torch-complex==0.2.0 [pip3] torch-optimizer==0.0.1a16 [pip3] torchaudio==0.7.0 [pip3] warprnnt-pytorch==0.1 [conda] blas 1.0 mkl [conda] cudatoolkit 11.0.221 h6bb024c_0 [conda] mkl 2020.2 256 [conda] mkl-service 2.3.0 py38he904b0f_0 [conda] mkl_fft 1.2.0 py38h23d657b_0 [conda] mkl_random 1.1.1 py38h0573a6f_0 [conda] numpy 1.19.2 py38h54aff64_0 [conda] numpy-base 1.19.2 py38hfa32c7d_0 [conda] pytorch 1.7.0 py3.8_cuda11.0.221_cudnn8.0.3_0 pytorch [conda] pytorch-ranger 0.1.1 pypi_0 pypi [conda] pytorch-wpe 0.0.0 pypi_0 pypi [conda] torch-complex 0.2.0 pypi_0 pypi [conda] torch-optimizer 0.0.1a16 pypi_0 pypi [conda] torchaudio 0.7.0 pypi_0 pypi [conda] warprnnt-pytorch 0.1 dev_0 Task information:
Task: asr1 Recipe: commonvoice ESPnet2
To Reproduce To Build espnet with cuda11 I had to make some tweaks:
changed install_chainer_ctc.sh git repo to: https://github.com/r4nc0r/chainer_ctc.git (it is a current fork of the offical chainer_ctc repo with only one change: it uses https://github.com/r4nc0r/warp-ctc instead of the original) My own Warp-Ctc fork removes the following line set(CUDA_NVCC_FLAGS "${CUDA_NVCC_FLAGS} -gencode arch=compute_30,code=sm_30 -O2") because compute_30 is not supported with cuda-11 and I need Cuda 11 because I Use a rtx 3090 changed install_warp-transducer.sh to use https://github.com/r4nc0r/warp-transducer.git (it is a current fork of the offical chainer_ctc repo with only one change: removed set(CUDA_NVCC_FLAGS "${CUDA_NVCC_FLAGS} -gencode arch=compute_30,code=sm_30 -O2") from CMAKELIST Not Installation of Cuda 11 and Pytorch 1.7 is a success move to a recipe directory, e.g., cd egs2/commonvoice/asr1 change local/data.sh to use lang=de change run.sh to use lang=de and nbpe=250 (last b.c. if you use the normal 150 the language model fails with too small vocabulary) execute run.sh specify the error log, e.g., exp/lm_train_lm_bpe250/train.log
Error logs <denchmark-h:h1>python3 -m espnet2.bin.lm_train --ngpu 1 --use_preprocessor true --bpemodel data/token_list/bpe_unigram250/bpe.model --token_type bpe --token_list data/token_list/bpe_unigram250/tokens.txt --non_linguistic_symbols none --cleaner none --g2p none --valid_data_path_and_name_and_type dump/raw/dev_de/text,text,text --valid_shape_file exp/lm_stats_bpe250/valid/text_shape.bpe --fold_length 150 --resume true --output_dir exp/lm_train_lm_bpe250 --config conf/train_lm.yaml --train_data_path_and_name_and_type dump/raw/srctexts,text,text --train_shape_file exp/lm_stats_bpe250/train/text_shape.bpe --ngpu 1 --multiprocessing_distributed True</denchmark-h>
